snippet: The agreement is believed to be the first of its kind between a major programmer and any of the technology giants that are trying to disrupt traditional modes of TV delivery.
abstract: Viacom tentatively agrees to let its popular cable channels, like Nickelodeon and MTV, be carried by an as-yet-unnamed Internet television service that Sony is creating; agreement is believed to be first of its kind between a major programmer and any of the technology giants that are trying to disrupt traditional modes of TV delivery.
lead_paragraph: The agreement is believed to be the first of its kind between a major programmer and any of the technology giants that are trying to disrupt traditional modes of TV delivery.

headline.main: Sony and Viacom Reach Tentative Deal to Stream Cable Channels
headline.print_headline: Sony and Viacom Reach Tentative Deal to Stream Cable Channels
